alert.note: Alert for Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Tammany Parish through 130 PM CDT... At 1247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Madisonville, or 14 miles south of Covington, moving north at 20 mph. Outflow winds in advance of this storm will reach the Lake Pontchartrain shoreline near Mandeville, well in advance of the thunderstorm, between 1 PM and 115 PM. HAZARD...Winds of 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madisonville and Lacombe. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 72 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
